1.heading: Dr. Raccoon.
1.title: "Brain Surgery"
1.author: [No author]
1.series: Oswald) 10 p. in New Funnies, no. 68
notes: MSU copy missing p. 2-5.

SUMMARY (beginning with p. 6): Woody the Woodpecker falls from a train and dents his brain pan. Dr. Raccoon puts in a spare square nut to tighten his cerebral processes, and Woody ends up flying in squares like a maniac. Oswald removes the nut and Woody resumes his normal flying in circles like a maniac. I. Oswald. k. Surgery. k. Woody Woodpecker. k. Dr. Raccoon. k. Raccoons. k. Brain pans. k. Cerebral processes. k. Squares. k. Circles. Call no.: PN6728.1.D4F8no.68

22.heading: Dr. Sam and the Spacemasters (1).
22.title: "As Sam Battles the Thugs, the Telephone Rings Frantically"
22.author: Westermann.
notes: p. 32 in Cartoon Parade, v. 7, no. 68 (Jan. 1973). Summary: Robbers have tied up the butler and are waiting for Sam, who's needed in surgery.

23.heading: Dr. Sam and the Spacemasters (2).
23.title: "The Careful, Masterful Surgery by Dr. Sam Medeck is Held in Awe by the Brain Specialists that Assist Him!"
23.author: Westermann
23.appears_in: p. 33 in Cartoon Parade, v. 7, no. 68 (Jan. 1973).
notes: Summary: The robbers are in jail ("how could one 'soft' doctor cause us so much trouble?") and Sam has made it to the operating room.

24.heading: Dr. Sam and the Spacemasters (3).
24.title: "As Sam Attempts to Allay Julie's Fears, an Event is Happening Only Blocks Away that could Indeed Effect the Lives of Julie, Sam, and the World!"
24.author: Westermann
24.appears_in: p. 34 in Cartoon Parade, v. 7, no. 68 (Jan. 1973).
notes: Summary: Julie has a premonition, and a giant spaceship is hovering over a "suitably large bank."

25.heading: Dr. Sam and the Spacemasters (4).
25.title: "Fantastic as it may seem, we are Witnessing an Actual Invasion from Space, But There is No Reason for Alarm Yet!"
25.author: Westermann
25.appears_in: p. 35 in Cartoon Parade, v. 7, no. 68 (Jan. 1973).
notes: Summary: The invaders of New Metro are carrying bars of gold that say "Libero II" on them, and Sam seems to know what it means.

26.heading: Dr. Sam and the Spacemasters (5).
26.title: "It's All a Matter of Gravity Control, Gentlemen"
26.author: Westermann
26.appears_in: p. 36 in Cartoon Parade, v. 7, no. 68 (Jan. 1973).
notes: Summary: The invading Spacemasters were trying to make a bank deposit; when the police catch one of them he gets away by switching on his P.O.G. Harness (Power Over Gravity), and he drops a letter for the bank.

27.heading: Dr. Sam and the Spacemasters (6).
27.title: "I Must Know What Happened To My Father"
27.author: Westermann
27.appears_in: p. 37 in Cartoon Parade, v. 7, no. 68 (Jan. 1973).
notes: Summary: The Spacemasters have been giving Dr. Sam fortunes in gold for years, but this was a chance to catch one of them and ask about his missing father.
